creditline: The Christina N. and Swan J. Turnblad Memorial Fund
description: two separate photographic images forming one large image; large black and white image of three clasped hands at bottom center; smaller color images surrounding image of hands and handwritten notes in predominately white on black; color images include ethnographic and Western works of art, snapshots, and magazine clippings; blue cloth at left edge; green cloth in LLQ; red coffee cup at bottom left of center; turquoise up in URQ; green bottle, LLQ; framed in black frames
text: Sara Cwynar began Three Hands with a series of found photographs that reference a multinational business transaction from the 1970s. Seeking the meaning behind the hand gestures and the cultural as well as financial exchange being documented, she mapped out a dizzying assortment of found images and objects, spanning world history. The result is a flattening of both space and time in an encyclopedic attempt to unpack a moment that is utterly irretrievable.
title: Three Hands
